column4: Ontza: im gonna try reseting router settings, that doesnt work....oh well linux. back to windows =/
you are running linux on your router?
ok well the OS of your computer has nothing to do with the router
the router has its own OS
so changing your pc's OS will have no effect on the router
that is the madwifi driver isn't it?
well there should be no problem then
it is probably some ubuntu thing, they abstract so much stuff that I don't have the energy to try to even go through the steps of figuring it out
meh you're gonna make me go back to windows?
just so much effort, I don't think you realize
can you at least point me in the right direction, some keywords to search, what to look for
that is the problem, it is so abstracted, that finding any support for it is near impossible, click and pray, the prayers fall through and you are screwed
ok...well what do you suggest I do?
might find a distro whose installation process is not as abstracted
